title: Getting Started
description: Learn how to install and run OmniSet on your Linux system in just a few minutes.

sections.title: What is OmniSet?
sections.content: OmniSet is a modular Linux setup tool that streamlines environment configuration. Select the modules you need and install them with one command. It supports 32+ modules across 16 categories - from development tools to creative software.

sections.title: Supported Platforms
sections.content:
OmniSet works on the following distributions:

- **Ubuntu** 20.04 and newer
- **Debian** 11 and newer
- **Fedora**
- **Arch Linux**
- **openSUSE**
- **Alpine Linux**

**Architectures:** Full amd64 support, partial arm64 and armhf compatibility.

sections.title: Quick Install
sections.content: The fastest way to get started is with the browser-based installer. Open your terminal and run:

sections.title: Alternative: Clone & Run
sections.content: If you prefer to inspect the code first, you can clone the repository and run locally:
sections.code:
git clone https://github.com/omnisetorg/omniset.git
cd omniset
./bin/omniset install --web

sections.title: What Happens Next
sections.content:
After running the install command:

1. **Browser opens** with the module selector interface
2. **Select modules** you want to install
3. **Confirm** your selection
4. **OmniSet installs** everything automatically

The installer prefers native apt/deb packages. Flatpak and Snap are used only as fallbacks when native packages aren't available.

sections.title: Post-Installation
sections.content:
After installation completes:

1. **Restart your terminal** to load new shell configurations
2. **Log out and back in** if you installed Docker (to apply group membership)
3. **Reboot** if you installed graphics drivers or system-level tools
